abstract: The supply of low-cost generic versions of cancer and AIDS treatments for the developing world could be blocked if Novartis wins a legal challenge to India’s patent law.
snippet: The supply of low-cost generic versions of cancer and AIDS treatments for the developing world could be blocked if Novartis wins a legal challenge to India’s patent law.
lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI, Jan. 29  The supply of low-cost generic versions of cancer and AIDS treatments for the developing world could be blocked if Novartis wins a legal challenge to India’s patent law, patients’ rights groups have contended.

headline.main: Battle Pits Patent Rights Against Low-Cost Generic Drugs
headline.print_headline: Battle Pits Patent Rights Against Low-Cost Generic Drugs
